item.title: 联合利华因美国和印度市场对美容品牌的需求而提升销售额
item.description: 联合利华公司作为全球最大的消费品集团之一，去年年底公布的销售额超出预期，这得益于在美国和印度等主要市场高端美容及家居护理产品的强劲表现。【原文：Unilever Plc, one of the world’s biggest consumer goods groups, posted better-than-expected sales at the end of last year, boosted by premium beauty and home care products in key markets including the US and India.】

item.title: 英国经济增速低于预期，斯塔默遭遇新挫折
item.description: 英国第四季度经济增速低于预期，给正竭力挽救首相职位的基尔·斯塔默施加了更大压力。【原文：The UK economy grew less than forecast in the fourth quarter, piling pressure on Keir Starmer as he battles to save his premiership.】

item.title: 软银因押注OpenAI估值提升而扭亏为盈
item.description: 软银集团在孙正义押注OpenAI后，因人工智能支出前景乐观带来的估值收益而扭亏为盈，重返季度盈利。【原文：SoftBank Group Corp. sprang back to a quarterly profit after Masayoshi Son’s bet on OpenAI paid off in valuation gains on optimism around artificial intelligence spending.】

item.title: 英国第四季度经济增速低于预期
赛诺菲突然更换领导层，保罗·赫德森被撤换
item.description: 赛诺菲首席执行官保罗·哈德森将被默克集团的贝伦·加里霍接替，此前这家法国制药公司决定不再续聘其任期。【原文：Sanofi’s Chief Executive Officer Paul Hudson will be replaced by Merck KGaA’s Belén Garijo, after the French drugmaker decided not to renew his term.】

item.title: 三星宣布开始向客户商业化出货HBM4
item.description: 三星电子已向某未具名客户开始商业化出货其最新版本的HBM4内存芯片，这标志着其在高风险的人工智能内存市场中领先于竞争对手。【原文：Samsung Electronics Co. has begun commercial shipments of the latest version of its HBM4 memory chips to an unnamed customer, signaling a strategic lead over its rivals in the high-stakes AI memory market.】

item.title: 日本保险丑闻持续发酵，第一生命曝出违规行为
item.description: 日本保险业正因一系列丑闻而陷入困境，这些丑闻暴露了保险公司对员工监管不力，在政府试图推动更多个人投资之际，严重动摇了公众对该行业的信任。【原文：Japan’s insurance industry is reeling from a raft of scandals that have exposed companies’ lax supervision of its employees, undermining trust in the sector at a time when the government is trying to drive more investment by individuals.】

item.title: 百威英博以无酒精啤酒和高端产品销售抵消啤酒销量下滑
item.description: 安海斯-布希英博公司通过其他地区业务的增长以及高端产品销量的提升，抵消了欧洲和北美市场销量疲软的影响。【原文：Anheuser-Busch InBev offset weaker volumes in Europe and North America with growth in other regions and stronger sales of premium products.】

item.title: 西门子上调业绩预期，自动化需求抵消汇率拖累
item.description: 西门子股份公司上调了业绩预期，因工厂自动化和电气化产品需求增长推动收益提升，从而抵消了负面汇率影响。【原文：Siemens AG raised its outlook after demand for factory automation and electrification products boosted returns to help cushion negative currency effects.】

item.title: 蒂森克虏伯维持盈利预期，尽管经济疲软
item.description: Thyssenkrupp AG reaffirmed its full-year outlook despite restructuring costs at its steel division and a weak industrial backdrop weighing on performance.

item.title: 梅赛德斯预计今年利润率将持平，受中国市场压力影响
item.description: 梅赛德斯-奔驰集团预计今年利润率仍将面临压力，因其正面临关税压力及中国市场的激烈竞争。【原文：Mercedes-Benz Group AG expects margins to remain under pressure this year as it grapples with tariffs and fierce competition in China.】

item.title: 印度银行现金过剩为贷款机构创造套利机会
item.description: 印度银行体系流动性的激增为贷款机构创造了套利机会，使其能够低成本借款，并将资金存入央行以获取更高利率。【原文：The surge in India’s banking liquidity has opened up an arbitrage opportunity for lenders, enabling them to borrow cheaply and park the money with the central bank at a higher rate.】

item.title: 中国禁止汽车低价销售以终结长期价格战
item.description: 中国已禁止汽车制造商以低于成本的价格销售车辆，此举旨在加强对持续价格战的打击力度，这场价格战已席卷全球最大的汽车市场。【原文：China has banned carmakers from pricing vehicles below cost, intensifying its crackdown on a persistent price war that’s engulfed the world’s largest auto market.】

item.title: GQG在印度持有逾240亿美元资产，股市"完美风暴"趋缓
item.description: 尽管印度股市遭遇数十年来最严重的严重跑输大盘表现，GQG Partners LLC仍未却步，押注银行股将引领盈利复苏。【原文：The steepest underperformance of Indian stocks in decades isn’t deterring GQG Partners LLC as it bets on banks to lead a recovery in earnings.】

item.title: 美日聚焦能源与芯片领域，设立5500亿美元基金
item.description: 知情人士透露，随着美日两国着手启动去年达成的双边贸易协定关键环节，东京5500亿美元投资基金首批三个项目即将敲定。【原文：The US and Japan are closing in on the first three projects to be funded by Tokyo’s $550 billion investment vehicle, according to people familiar with the matter, as the nations seek to set in motion a key component of their bilateral trade deal reached last year.】

item.title: 丰田推迟350亿美元交易截止期限，该交易遭埃利奥特反对
item.description: 丰田集团延长了其关键部门私有化竞标的投标期限，这表明这家日本企业集团需要更多时间来争取股东支持，以应对埃利奥特投资管理公司阻挠该交易的强力推动。【原文：The Toyota group extended the tender period for its bid to privatize a key unit, signaling the Japanese conglomerate needs more time to rally shareholder support in the face of an aggressive push by Elliott Investment Management to block the deal.】

item.title: 阿曼股市有望创2014年以来最佳周表现，因其寻求新兴市场地位
item.description: 阿曼股市正迎来十余年来表现最佳的一周，因市场乐观预期该海湾交易所争取新兴市场地位的举措将吸引新一轮资金流入。【原文：Omani stocks are heading for their best week in more than a decade as optimism builds that the Gulf bourse’s push to be classified as an emerging market would unlock fresh investor inflows.】

item.title: 据Counterpoint数据显示，iPhone 17在1月逆势突破中国移动销售疲软局面
item.description: 据Counterpoint Research数据显示，苹果公司的iPhone是1月份在中国市场实现销售增长的唯一智能手机品牌。【原文：Apple Inc.’s iPhone was the only smartphone line to register growth in China sales in January, according to Counterpoint Research.】

item.title: 拍卖规则放宽后，外国投资者蜂拥购买赞比亚债券
item.description: 随着资金从美元计价资产转向高收益投资，在赞比亚政府取消非居民参与债务拍卖的限制后，外国投资者纷纷涌入该国本地债券市场。【原文：Foreigners have piled into Zambia’s local bond market following the government’s move to lift a cap on non-resident participation in debt auctions, as money shifts from dollar-denominated assets into higher-yielding investments.】

item.title: 印度农民抗议莫迪与特朗普签署的贸易协议
item.description: 印度各地数千名农民即将聚集，发起大规模抗议活动，反对该国与美国达成的这项期待已久的贸易协议。组织者称，该协议可能为进口商品铺平道路，从而损害国内农业。【原文：Thousands of farmers across India are set to gather for large-scale protests against the country’s long-awaited trade deal with the United States, an agreement that organizers say could pave the way for imports that will hurt domestic agriculture.】

item.title: 联想销售额因人工智能和抢购内存产品而提升
item.description: 联想集团有限公司公布的销售额超出预期，这得益于消费者在预期内存芯片价格上涨前抢购个人电脑，以及其人工智能服务器的强劲势头。【原文：Lenovo Group Ltd. reported better-than-expected sales, helped by consumers buying PCs ahead of anticipated memory chip price hikes as well as strong momentum for its AI servers.】

item.title: 阿根廷参议院通过米莱劳工改革案，迈出关键第一步
item.description: 阿根廷参议员于周四凌晨通过了总统哈维尔·米莱标志性的劳动改革法案，这是这位自由主义者雄心勃勃议程的关键进展，有望助力其政府重返国际市场。【原文：Senators in Argentina passed President Javier Milei’s signature labor reform bill early Thursday, a key step forward for the libertarian’s ambitious agenda that could support his government’s return to international markets.】

item.title: 应用材料公司将支付2.525亿美元以了结美国调查
item.description: 应用材料公司将支付2.525亿美元，以了结美国商务部对其向中国不当出口设备的调查，为这家美国最大的芯片制造设备供应商长达数年的风波画上句号。【原文：Applied Materials Inc. will pay $252.5 million to settle a US Commerce Department investigation into improper exports to China, ending a yearslong saga for the largest American supplier of chipmaking machinery.】

item.title: 据称因投资者反对 清街公司考虑缩减IPO规模
item.description: 据知情人士透露，清街集团正考虑缩减首次公开募股的规模及价格区间。【原文：Clear Street Group Inc. is considering reducing the size and price range of its initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 柬埔寨出台新法严打诈骗农场犯罪团伙
item.description: 柬埔寨正在起草一项针对网络诈骗的法律，旨在建立一道防线，阻止犯罪分子利用该国作为基地，从全球受害者手中骗取数十亿美元。【原文：Cambodia is drafting a law targeting online scams, seeking to build a bulwark against criminals using the country as a base to siphon billions of dollars from victims globally.】

item.title: 铜价上涨，金属市场因需求前景及美元走势延续涨势
item.description: 铜价延续涨势，得益于供应前景趋紧及美元走软，尽管中国买家在农历新年假期前采购意愿减弱。【原文：Copper extended gains, buoyed by a tighter supply outlook and a weakening dollar, even as Chinese buying waned ahead of the Lunar New Year break.】

item.title: SBI时隔15年首次在市值上超越TCS
item.description: 投资者正转向投资国内业务为主的企业。【原文：Investors are rotating into domestically focused names.】

item.title: 大豆价格触及两个月高点，因中美停火期延长引发乐观情绪
item.description: 美国大豆期货触及两个月高点，此前有关中美可能延长贸易休战的报道提振了市场对美国农产品将获得更多采购的预期。【原文：US soybean futures hit their highest in two months after a report on a potential extended trade truce between the US and China fueled hopes for additional purchases of American agricultural products.】

item.title: 经合组织称菲律宾必须应对财政缺口，减少税收优惠
item.description: 经济合作与发展组织指出，菲律宾必须加大力度缩减长期存在的预算赤字，并考虑削减财政激励措施，以帮助其维持经济增长势头。【原文：The Philippines must step up efforts to reduce its persistent budget deficits and consider paring back fiscal incentives to help it sustain its economic momentum, according to the Organisation for Economic Co-operation & Development.】
